The reason light cannot escape is not that it slows down. One possible analogy is to circular motion in classical mechanics - where the object may be accelerating towards the centre of rotation but nevertheless maintains a constant speed and never gets closer or further away. This is achieved by curving the path of the object. The same principle keeps the earth in orbit around the Sun. The earth is moving very fast even though it doesn't get (much) closer of further away from the Sun.
